data.title: Service was really slow but good was worth the wait
data.text: Had the rack of lamb and it was incredible. Took forever to get a waitress and then to even get our drinks before we could order.  We were eating with friends so we easily filled the time chatting. If we had small children in the group the wait would have been unpleasant.

data.title: Fantastic food and Atmosphere
data.text:
First time at this restaurant. Not real big place, but an upscale restaurant and bar. The waitress was professional, prompt and helpful with the selection of food. The meals were delicious. There was also entertainment. Didn't get her name, but she sang R &B and had a beautiful voice. 
Would definitely recommend this restaurant!!

data.title: Great place for a rehearsal dinner
data.text: Initially, I was wary because the room was not set up by the promised time, but their large group coordinator had just resigned.  The staff responded quickly to the problem, however.  The servers were flexible, responsive, polite, and professional, and went with the flow.  When our credit card was charged in error 4 times due to a "computer glitch", the person who took my call resolved it immediately by calling my credit card company right away to remove the charges, given that I needed that credit card for other wedding charges that next day.  The food was outstanding!

data.title: Burger and brew.
data.text: The burger was pricey, but it was a top five burger. Great beers and good services. N doubt this place is hidden in this awesome hotel. It's worth searching out for high quality eats.

data.title: Bar help
data.text: The guy behind the Bar was very busy as he was doing everything himself. Taking orders, bringing orders to the table, making all the drinks. It left very little time for him to do anything else and customers waiting.

data.title: Nice dining experience
data.text: The chef here is creative and we enjoyed dining here.  The service was good and we used our hotel drink tickets for wine.  I had the curry with seafood and it was wonderful.  It had a small amount of the very rich curry and the jasmine rice was nutty and cooked well.  It came with a house salad and I had their house dressing, which is good.  They served some rolls which were nice, warm, and tasty.  There were four different rolls, which is good for options.  My wife had the scallops and changed the prep to have mashed potatoes and asparagus.  They were great.  We were too full to have dessert.  This is a real plus to have in the hotel and makes a good package as one does not have to go outside for anything while here if it is raining, which it was.  I would definitley return.

data.title: Good food, pleasent atmosphere, excellent service.
data.text: The meals are appetizing, the coffee is very good, and the service is friendly and efficient. The menu has a nice variety of options, a nice selection of wines, and the prices are moderate.

data.title: Delicious dinner and breakfast
data.text:
This friendly restaurant prepared scallops and salmon perfectly.
The service was prompt and attentive.

data.title: Great Food!
data.text: Was pleased to find this restaurant in the lobby of our hotel- didn't want to go out again.  Ordered some delicious pizza and drinks.  Service was terrific, food was very good, and the price was reasonable.

data.title: A great, fairly expensive, restaurant
data.text: Went there two nights. First night we had the best rack of lamb ever served with wonderful braised spinach and potatoes, $39. Second night we had the best scallops ever, unusually tender, $28. Their rolls are great. Highly recommended.

data.title: Always a nice night out
data.text:
Two25 is our favorite Peoria restaurant.  Celina our server is perfectly attentive, and if she serves you more than once she will remember your preferences.  I tried the lobster bisque (one of my sons favorites) deliciously creamy.  I opted for the pear salad with chicken for dinner, a large salad with great taste which I could not finish.  My husband had the filet which was prepared exactly to his preference. He said it was great.  
The menu offers a nice variety of fare and price.  We've enjoyed the bar as well- informative bartender.

data.title: Great little find....
data.text: Our daughter scheduled her rehearsal dinner here, never having eaten or even been in the hotel, so we thought we should check it out .... pleasantly surprised .... food was fabulous (Amish chicken & Divers scallops), service was quick and professional, atmosphere unique .... Will definitely be back!!!!

data.title: Good selection of beers
data.text: I stay at the Mark Twain when I am in Peoria for business and usually plan on a couple beers and dinner or appetizers at Two25, the bar/restaurant in the hotel.  They always have a good selection of dark beers and stouts.  I have not eaten in the actual restaurant but usually just prop up the bar and eat there.  The appetizers are all good and the staff has always been very friendly.

data.title: Consistently great food
data.text: Had the lobster bisque and a salad for dinner.  Both were exceptional.  The presentation was lovely and the food was very prompt.  I also had the breakfast buffet in the morning and the made to order omelet was perfect!  So glad this restaurant is in the hotel as I don't even have to consider looking anywhere else!

data.title: Not good
data.text: The atmosphere is really cool,  but the food was very disappointing. We went in thinking it was an upscale dining experience and we were very disappointed. The food was very lacking and not very good considering the price. Needless to say we will not be back.

owner_response.author: Two25Peoria, General Manager at Two25, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Please let me know when you were in the restaurant and what you ate.  I apologize for your experience and wish you had let us know while you were still at Two25.  Thank You for your time.
Sue
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great bar, very good food, live jazz, but a bit pricy
data.text: I visited this place based on a recommendation from a friend, and came away extremely impressed.  They had at least a dozen very good microbrew beers on tap, and a pageful of others in bottles.  The bartenders are very knowledgeable.  We had  a nice dinner, but it was a bit expensive.  On Friday evenings, they have a live jazz band, including a legendary trumpet player who toured with Ray Charles.  They seemed to close early for a downtown location.  I recommend dropping by for a bit and a few drinks, especially on Friday evenings.

data.title: Nice dinner
data.text: Nice family dinner... The pear salad with Salmon was great and 2 in the group had the giant burgers.  All was fresh and delicious.  Nice waiters who were prompt and professional

data.title: Lovely date night spot
data.text: This is our favorite spot for date night. We love the ambience and the building is very neat as well.

data.title: 3 Generations Satsfied!
data.text:
We had dinner on a Friday night with our daughter, SIL and grandson.  Service was brisk and efficient without being over the top.

Our appetizers were outstanding and piping hot.  Salads were run of the mill, but nothing special.  The entrees were outstanding.  Two Amish chicken, two salmon and the 7 year old enjoyed his Mac and cheese (pretty sure the Mac and cheese was Kraft, but the grandson like it.). 

Prices were fair, with the exception of wine.  350% markup is excessive.

data.title: Bad food, Bad server
data.text: Went to Two25 for a final dinner with friends before we leave the USA. Have to say, the server was rude, had no etiquette, and spoiled the whole evening. He tried to remove my plate from under my arm whilst I was pouring wine. The food was over cooked. My chicken was like shoe leather. I did not complain as the server was so miserable.
